Robert Talbert, PhD.
About Research Speaking Teaching

Speaking

In addition to my duties as a professor, I serve as a speaker and consultant to a variety of audiences on teaching and learning, especially university mathematics education, the flipped classroom, and the integration of technology in mathematics teaching and learning. My experiences range from small-group intensive workshops with high school calculus teachers and two-year college STEM faculty, to international keynote presentations and webinars.

Click here for more information on retaining me as a speaker at your upcoming conference or event, or as a consultant for your faculty.

  • Flipped Infrastructures for Inquiry-Based Learning (Contibuted talk, 18th Annual Legacy of R. L. Moore/Inquiry Based Learning conference; June 25, 2015, Austin, TX)
  • Creating Flipped Learning Experiences in the College Mathematics Classroom (Minicourse, MAA MathFest; August 6 and 8, 2015, Washington DC)
  • Rethinking Class Time Using Accessible Technology (Keynote, Kansas City Regional Mathematics Technology Expo; October 2, 2015, Kansas City, MO)
